required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 1 Study of SQ3370 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Phase 1, Open-Label Study of SQ3370 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and preliminary activity of SQ3370 in patients with advanced solid tumors.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to approximately 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: To determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose, if possible, and/or Recommended Phase 2 Dose of SQ3370

primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to approximately 24 weeks
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate safety. Defined as type, frequency, severity, timing of onset, duration, and relationship to study drugs of any treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs); laboratory abnormalities; vital sign abnormalities; adverse electrocardiogram (ECG) or, ECH/MUGA findings; SAEs; or AEs leading to interruption, modification, or discontinuation of study treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to approximately 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: To determine Maximum Plasma concentration (Cmax) for SQP33 protodrug and active Dox following SQ3370 treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to end of follow up or 72 weeks after accrual of the final subject
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as achievement of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) by RECIST v1.1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to end of follow up or 72 weeks after accrual of the final subject
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the interval from the first documentation of objective response to the earlier of the first documentation of disease progression or death from any cause

other_outcome.measure: Evaluate level of SQP33 in tumor
other_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to approximately 12 weeks
other_outcome.description: To determine the level of SQP33 protodrug and active Doxorubicin in tumor tissue

other_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment to approximately 12 weeks
other_outcome.description: To assess immune response (changes in immune biomarkers) as assessed by PBMCs

arm_group.description: Participants will receive 10 mL of SQL70 biopolymer injected intratumorally on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle into a single lesion and then receive escalating doses of SQP33 protodrug administered IV from Day 1 through Day 5 (5 doses) of each 21-day cycle.

Participants will receive 20 mL of SQL70 biopolymer injected intratumorally on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle into a single lesion and then receive escalating doses of SQP33 protodrug administered IV from Day 1 through Day 5 (5 doses) of each 21-day cycle.

Participants will receive SQL70 biopolymer injected intratumorally on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle into a single lesion as determined in Dose Escalation. Then will receive a lower dose than RP2D of SQP33 protodrug administered IV from Day 1 through Day 5 (5 doses) of each 21-day cycle.

Participants will receive SQL70 biopolymer injected intratumorally on Day 1 of each 21-day cycle into a single lesion as determined in Dose Escalation. Then will receive the RP2D of SQP33 protodrug administered IV from Day 1 through Day 5 (5 doses) of each 21-day cycle.

intervention.description: SQ3370 consists of 2 components: SQL70, a protodrug-activating biopolymer, and SQP33, a protodrug of Doxorubicin

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Diagnosis of advanced soft tissue sarcoma or other solid tumors
2. Adequate hematologic, hepatic, renal, and coagulation function
3. ECOG performance status score 0-1
4. Tumor is the type where published clinical data would suggest that anthracyclines have cytotoxic activity
5. Injectable tumor present
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Prior exposure to 300 mg/m^2 of Dox HCl or DOXIL / CAELYX Â® or 600 mg/m^2 of Epirubicin HCl
2. Congestive heart failure (CHF), severe myocardial insufficiency, or cardiac arrhythmia
3. Any of the following within 28 days prior to Cycle 1 Day 1:
- Major surgery, as defined by the Investigator
- Radiotherapy
- Chemotherapy, immunotherapy and/or anticancer therapy (except for small molecule kinase inhibitors, which are 6 elimination half-lives)
4. Trastuzumab or trastuzumab emtansine dosed within 7 months prior to Cycle 1 Day 1.
5. Any transfusion within 14 days prior to Cycle 1 Day 1.
6. Pregnant or breast-feeding women.
7. Known active CNS metastases and/or carcinomatous meningitis or symptomatic brain metastasis. Participants with previously treated brain metastases may participate provided they are radiologically stable
8. History of allergic reactions attributed to Dox or other anthracyclines, NaHA, hyaluronic acid, or gram-positive bacterial proteins
9. History or evidence of clinically unstable/uncontrolled disorder, condition, or disease
